sections.heading: Short Title.
sections.text: This Act may be cited as the Mortgage Insurance Limitation and Notification Act.

sections.heading: Application.
sections.text:
This Act applies to mortgages entered into on or
after the effective date of this Act and only to the principal single family
residence of the mortgagor.

sections.heading: Definitions.
sections.text: For the purpose of this Act:

sections.heading: Transaction disclosure.
sections.text:
After July 1, 1998, if a person enters
into a transaction to obtain a mortgage for his or her principal residence and
private mortgage insurance may be required in connection with that transaction,
the mortgagee shall disclose in writing all of the following:

sections.heading: Annual notification statement.
sections.text:
After July 1, 1998, in addition to
the transaction disclosure requirement set forth in Section 15 and
within 30 days after the end of the calendar year, the mortgagee shall inform
the mortgagor in writing of the procedure to cancel the private mortgage
insurance together with the telephone number and address. The annual statement
required by this Section may be printed on or included with any other annual
statement that is required by any federal or State law to be made by the
mortgagee to the mortgagor.

sections.heading: Federal law.
sections.text:
If federal law is enacted governing or otherwise
regulating private mortgage insurance, a mortgagee who is governed by the
provisions of this Act may have the option to comply with the federal law, and
compliance with the federal law by the mortgagee shall be deemed compliance
with this Act.

sections.heading: Severability.
sections.text:
The provisions of this Act are severable under
Section 1.31 of the Statute on Statutes.
